sentences.text: Long-term performance-based incentive awards for 2017 were redesigned to measure the Companys performance against the performance of a comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objectives of our executive compensation program are to align executive pay with stockholder value and motivate executives to achieve our corporate goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This CD&A describes the elements, implementation, and 2016 results of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee provided no base salary increases for NEOs for 2016, except in connection with promotions, as a result of 2015 TSR performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believed that salary increases for 2016 were not warranted in light of our TSR performance in 2015, with the exceptions of increases due to promotions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Killinger was promoted to Executive Vice President and received a commensurate salary increase in February 2016, and Mr. Gutierrez was promoted to Chief Executive Officer and received a commensurate salary increase in December 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we received 92% support for our say on pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we believe that our stockholders understand that our pay practices demonstrate our commitment to pay for performance and that our compensation plans are designed to recognize the performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We achieved many of our operational and financial goals in 2016, including exceeding our Adjusted Free Cash Flow and Adjusted EBITDA targets, as well as surpassing our goals for debt reduction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These achievements resulted in payouts under our short-term incentive plan (our AIP) in excess of target (described in more detail in the section entitled Annual Incentive Compensation below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the market value of our common stock increased by 6.4% in 2016, our TSR performance has struggled over the past three-year performance period; as a result, realized and realizable long-term incentive awards under our L TIP lost 86% of their value relative to target (described in more detail in the section entitled Realized Pay in 2016 below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a combined basis (all payments made under our short- and long-term incentive plans, our AIP and L TIP, respectively), total NEO incentive compensation for 2016 lost approximately 28% of its value relative to target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee exercised discretion to reduce long-term equity awards for NEOs who were Executive Vice Presidents as of January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the January 2016 grant, the Compensation Committee reduced equity award values for each Executive Vice President by 40% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since long-term equity awards are based on a percentage of an NEOs salary, and not a number of shares, the reductions were meant to moderate the imbedded benefit that could result from a grant of equity awards during a period when the Companys stock price was at historically low levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs did not receive any stock upon the vesting of their performance-based long-term incentive awards, MSUs, in 2016 or 2017, due to the decline in TSR during the performance periods ending December 31, 2015 and December 31, 2016, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the objectives of our compensation program, the accomplishment of our corporate goals and the market performance of our common stock over the three-year performance period directly impacted our compensation decisions and pay outcomes in 2016 as described below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program ties a significant portion of our NEOs overall compensation to the achievement of increases in TSR through our long-term compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the intended design of our long-term compensation program, there was no payout of stock for MSU awards with performance periods ending December 31, 2015 (vesting January 2, 2016) and December 31, 2016 (vesting January 2, 2017) as a result of the decline in TSR below the performance threshold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These MSUs represent two-thirds of long-term compensation value granted to our NEOs in 2013 and 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee did not provide for any merit increases to NEO 2016 base salary compensation from 2015 base salary compensation due to the Companys TSR decline through 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee used its authority to reduce 2016 long-term incentive awards due to the Companys TSR decline through 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP performance metrics were exceeded during 2016, which resulted in payments to our NEOs at levels greater than target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs did not realize any value on vested MSU awards in 2016 or 2017 as a result of TSR decline over relevant performance periods (2013 through 2015, and 2014 through 2016, respectively).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Adjusted Free Cash Flow and Adjusted EBITDA each exceeded target, and our Corporate Debt to Corporate EBITDA Ratio, a performance metric added by the Compensation Committee for 2016 as a result of stockholder engagement, greatly exceeded the maximum.

sentences.text: Due to the achievement of the AIP performance metrics, our NEOs received AIP bonuses at levels above target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts under the AIP for 2016 were made at levels greater than target, driven by achievement of AIP performance metrics: Adjusted Free Cash Flow and Adjusted EBITDA exceeded target and Corporate Debt to Corporate EBITDA Ratio achieved maximum.

sentences.text: 6.4 Amendment of the Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a Participant ceases to be eligible under Section 2.1 hereof for any reason, the dollar amount in such Participants Account will be refunded to the Participant, or in the case of death, the Participants designated beneficiary or estate, or otherwise distributed in accordance with policies and procedures prescribed by the Committee in cases where such a refund may not be possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors or the Boards Compensation Committee may at any time, or from time to time, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan in any respect, except that, without approval of the shareholders, no amendment may increase the aggregate number of shares reserved under the Plan other than as provided in Section 4.2 hereof, materially increase the benefits accruing to Participants or materially modify the requirements as to eligibility for participation in the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any amendment of the Plan must be made in accordance with applicable provisions of the Code and/or any regulations issued thereunder, any other applicable law or regulations, and the requirements of the principal exchange upon which the Common Stock is listed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARTICLE VI GENERAL PROVISIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.1 Notices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any notice which a Participant files pursuant to the Plan shall be made on forms prescribed by the Committee and shall be effective only when received by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: APPENDIX B
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.5 Application of Funds
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.10 Expenses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All funds received by the Company by reason of purchases of Common Stock hereunder shall constitute general funds of the Company and may be used for any corporate purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expenses of administering the Plan shall be borne by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.11 Titles and Headings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The titles and headings of the sections in this Plan are for convenience of reference only, and in the event of any conflict, the text of this Plan, rather than such titles or headings, shall control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.6 Legal Restrictions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall not be obligated to sell shares of Common Stock hereunder if counsel to the Company determines that such sale would violate any applicable law or regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.12 Arbitration
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of any dispute between the Employer and a Participant with respect to this Plan, either may require that the dispute be determined by binding arbitration by written notice to the other.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such case, the arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect before a panel of three arbitrators, and the decision of the arbitrators shall be final and binding on the parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In any such arbitration, the non-prevailing party shall pay all expenses, including the costs of the arbitrators and the costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys fees, incurred by the prevailing party in the arbitration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.7 Gender
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whenever used herein, use of any gender shall be applicable to all genders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.8 Governing Law
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan and all rights and obligations thereunder shall be constructed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware and any applicable provisions of the Code and the related regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6.9 Indemnification
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: T o the extent allowable under applicable law, the Committee and the Plan Manager and any delegate thereof shall be indemnified and held harmless by the Company from any loss, cost, liability, or expense that may be imposed upon or reasonably incurred by such person in connection with or resulting from any claim, action, suit, or proceeding to which he or she may be a party or in which he or she may be involved by reason of any action or failure to act under the Plan and against and from any and all amounts paid by him or her in satisfaction of judgment in such action, suit, or proceeding against him or her, provided he or she gives the Company an opportunity, at its own expense, to handle and defend the same before he or she undertakes to handle and defend it on his or her own behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing right of indemnification shall not be exclusive of any other rights of indemnification to which such persons may be entitled under the Companys articles of incorporation or bylaws, as a matter of law, under any indemnification agreement or otherwise, or any power that the Company may have to indemnify them or hold them harmless.
